dict.string: CPUTrace (aka PCTrace) provides a precise record of every instruction executed, on all cores/threads, over a window of time. You can then see precisely where each cycle was spent across user and/or kernel space.
List of systems to be traced. Defaults to only tracing XNU.
Enable (1) or disable (0) streaming to filesystem. Defaults to enabled.
Enable (1) or disable (0) throttling a workload to reduce trace packet loss. Defaults to disabled.
Enable (1) or disable (0) capturing addresses. Records the address every time there is a load or store instruction. Defaults to disabled.

Rate-limit writes to the filesystem with a user-provided limit expressed in MB/s. When the hardware generates trace packets at a rate higher than the limit, data is discarded. This option requires --CPUTrace:stream to be enabled. By default, rate limiting is disabled.
Enable (1=ringbuffer, 2=ringbuffer-memory, 3=ringbuffer-filesystem) or disable (0) wraparound mode. Defaults to disabled.
Enable (1) or disable (0) production trace. Defaults to disabled.
Enable (1) or disable (0) driver trace. Defaults to enabled.
Record a process specified by pid_t. Specifying 0 for the process id will limit tracing to the kernel.
Enable (1) or disable (0) collecting all of the CPU Trace referenced symbols as part of the unified Symbols schema for the trace. Defaults to enabled.
Enable (1) or disable (0) copying images. This option causes a significant trace size increase. When the `decode` option is disabled, this makes the final trace portable to other machines.
Enable (1) or disable (0) decoding the CPU Trace on-device. This makes the final trace smaller and faster to open, but takes time. Defaults to enabled.
Compresses results while decoding, achieving 3-5x size reduction. Value must be a choice of an algorithm: LZ4, LZ4_RAW or LZFSE, Only valid when decode=1 is set.
Size of the virtual ringbuffer (memory, filesystem) in megabytes. Defaults to 0.
Size limit trace can use for recording in megabytes. Once reach the limit CPUTrace will stop processor trace data recording. Defaults to 0 - unlimited.
Dynamic trace buffer size in megabytes. Defaults to 0 - system picks an appropriate size.
Collect HW CPUTrace data alongside SW events
